author: Darnay Tripp
title: San Diego FC shut out in disappointing loss to Toronto - NBC 7 San Diego
text:
San Diego FC could've used a proven goal scorer Wednesday night.
Toronto shut out SDFC 1-0, for their second win in eight matches. The visitors arrived with just 18 points on the season, tied for the second worst record in Major League Soccer.
Stream San Diego News for free, 24/7, wherever you are with NBC 7.
 WATCH HERE Toronto led 1-0 after a 20th minute penalty kick. Franco Negri committed a foul in the penalty area, surrendering the attempt that Theo Corbeanu converted to give the visitors a leg up.
San Diego FC controlled possession like usual in the first half, but headed to the locker room without anything to show for it - not even a single shot.
Get top local San Diego stories delivered to you every morning with our News Headlines newsletter.
 SIGN UP SDFC held possession for 70.1 percent of the match but only registered two shots on goal.
It was a physical match that got chippy at points, with the clubs combining for nine yellow cards.
There was a controversial non-call on a handball in the second half that would've given San Diego a shot to get level.
The result comes a day after the club parted ways with second leading scorer after the sides failed to reach an agreement on an extension to Iloski's loan, which was set to expire at month's end.
Despite the loss San Diego FC ends the night where it began - sitting atop the Western Conference table. Second place Minnesota lost 1-0 to LAFC, while third place Vancouver topped Houston 3-0. The Whitecaps started the night four points back of SDFC.
San Diego is home for its next five matches, including Saturday's visit from Vancouver.

author: Push Square
title: Megaton Musashi W: Wired Review (PS5)
text: We've all been waiting years for the return of once prominent Japanese developer Level-5, but you'd be forgiven for being completely ignorant of its latest Western release, [Megaton Musashi W: Wired](games/ps5/megaton_musashi_w_wired). Thanks to what feels like a near total lack of marketing, this awkwardly named action RPG has sailed effortlessly under the radar ‚Äî but it definitely deserves more attention. Much like [Yo-Kai Watch](https://www.nintendolife.com/games/3ds/yo-kai_watch), Megaton Musashi is a multimedia property from Level-5, spanning games and anime. It's a sci-fi story about humanity making one last stand against an all-conquering alien menace, with Wired putting you in the pilot seat of ‚Äî you guessed it ‚Äî a giant robot that can finally turn the tide of this intergalactic war. The title's split between two distinct parts. The first has you wander around 2D environments, talking to key characters in order to progress the plot. The second plops you onto the battlefield in your aforementioned mech, ready to kick some extraterrestrial arse across a large number of objective-based missions. Both the characters and the dialogue appear very trope-heavy at first, but things do get somewhat interesting later on, as the narrative introduces a decent degree of tension between cast members. It's not what we'd call an amazing story, but it holds the action together rather well. Indeed, it's said action that'll keep you playing. With impressively accessible controls and responsive gameplay, there's a lot to like about Megaton Musashi's brand of mechanical carnage. It's fast-paced and punchy ‚Äî especially when you unleash super attacks ‚Äî but repeated enemy types do take the edge off ever so slightly. As you progress, you unlock new body parts and weapons for your robot through a generous loot system, which in turn lets you tackle increasingly dangerous missions. Decking out your mech with new equipment does lean into make big number go up territory at times, but it's still an addictive process overall. You can also hop online to tackle missions alongside other players, but at the time of writing this review, the game feels borderline abandoned. It's not a huge deal given the strength of the single-player offering, but it's still something to be aware of. Megaton Musashi W: Wired is one of those games where you can identify its flaws very quickly, but they're not going to stop you from having fun. Ultimately, it's the title's fast-flowing and easy-to-grasp combat that wins the day, bolstered by an addictive loot system and a moreish, mission-based campaign.

author: Richmondside Staff and Berkeleyside staff
title: Batten down the hatches: Berkeley under high wind and coastal flood advisories
text:
Expect possible king tides and a wet and windy Friday and Saturday, with sunnier weather on tap for Sunday. by Richmondside Staff and Berkeleyside Staff Dec. 13, 2024, 2:15 p.m. Dec. 13, 2024, 3:57 p.m. Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to print (Opens in new window) Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Click to share on Threads (Opens in new window) Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Can you imagine life without Berkeleyside? We‚Äôve been providing Berkeley with compelling, trustworthy local news for 15 years. Help keep our community-rooted reporting strong in 2025 by donating to our end-of-year fundraising campaign.
Yes! I want to support Berkeleyside!
The National Weather Service has issued wind and coastal flooding advisories across the Bay Area, including in Berkeley and Oakland.
Sustained winds of up to 40 mph, with gusts of up to 55 mph, could make it dangerous to drive high-profile vehicles and might knock down tree limbs, causing scattered power outages, according to the NWS Bay Area, which advises residents to ‚Äúsecure outdoor loose objects‚Äù and exercise caution on the roads.
Winds are expected to increase Friday afternoon and evening, with the advisory in effect from 4 p.m. Friday until 7 a.m. Saturday.
The National Weather Service Bay Area forecast is summarized here. Courtesy NWS Bay Area Light rain is likely to continue Friday, with more to come through Saturday; about 1 to 2 inches are possible in Berkeley and Oakland. Thunderstorms are also possible overnight into Saturday morning. Sunny weather is expected to return on Sunday.
On the flooding front, the possibility of king tides this weekend ‚Äî higher than normal tides peaking at about 7 feet ‚Äî has prompted a minor coastal flooding advisory that is in effect until 1 p.m. Monday for low-lying regions along the bay shoreline. The weather service reminds drivers not to drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
Conditions will likely also be hazardous for mariners: A small craft advisory is in effect from 3 p.m. to 9 p.m. Friday, with gusts of up to 35 knots and choppy water expected. The advisory will become a warning Friday night, with winds of up to 30 knots and ‚Äúvery rough waters‚Äù expected.
‚Ä¶ We have a small favor to ask. In this time of uncertainty, you can be sure of one thing: our reporters deliver high-impact, trustworthy local news about Berkeley each and every day. Our independent nonprofit journalism is free for everyone but not free to produce. If you value our work, please support our end-of-year fundraising campaign.
Yes, I want to support Berkeleyside! " * " indicates required fields

text:

O Audi RS3 retornar√° ao Brasil com a linguagem visual atualizada da marca. Destaques incluem grade dianteira ampliada em formato de colmeia, far√≥is Matrix LED com tr√™s op√ß√µes de luz diurna e acabamentos em preto brilhante nas laterais. As lanternas traseiras ganharam setas din√¢micas que "andam" de dentro para fora.
Sem valor divulgado ainda, o Audi RS3 2025 desembarca nas concession√°rias brasileiras no segundo semestre. A expectativa √© que mantenha posicionamento premium, acima dos R$ 500 mil.
Traseira com cara de supercarro
O visual radical continua na traseira, com difusores verticais no para-choque e escapamentos ovais em preto. O detalhe do refletor vermelho central refor√ßa o DNA esportivo do modelo.
As rodas de 19" em preto fosco com design em Y roubam a cena. Opcionalmente, clientes podem escolher vers√µes bicolor ou em cinza-escuro com 10 raios - perfeitas para quem busca personaliza√ß√£o.
Tecnologia e motoriza√ß√£o de arrepiar
O cockpit digital combina painel de 12,3" com central multim√≠dia de 10,1". Bancos tipo concha e volante achatado na base inferior garantem postura esportiva. Sensores monitoram em tempo real temperatura do motor e press√£o dos pneus.
O cora√ß√£o do RS3 segue sendo o 2.5 TFSI turbo de 5 cilindros: 400 cv de pot√™ncia e 51 kgfm de torque. A acelera√ß√£o de 0 a 100 km/h acontece em 3,8 segundos - n√∫meros que mant√™m o modelo como refer√™ncia na categoria.
O sistema Audi Drive Select oferece quatro op√ß√µes, incluindo o modo RS Torque traseiro para drift controlado. O bot√£o vermelho com √≠cone de bandeira quadriculada, ao lado do volante, ativa instantaneamente configura√ß√µes de pista.

author: Jessalin Heins-Nagamoto
title: Winter gardening tips for San Diego, CA - SDtoday
text: Be-leaf it or not, January is a good time to get gardening. Now is the time to shop seeds, do some routine maintenance, and even sow certain plants. üå± Spring for seeds Peruse seed catalogs and grab those springtime favorites that are so popular they tend to sell out come the thaw. We‚Äôre talking seeds like snap peas, radishes, specialty lettuces, and heirloom tomatoes. You can also get your wishlist going for the spring planting of fall bulbs like hostas, gladiolas, and dahlias. Check out these local spots to nab your favorites: [North Park Nursery](https://northparknursery.com/), 2335 University Ave., San Diego [Mission Hills Nursery](https://www.missionhillsnursery.com/), 1525 Fort Stockton Dr., San Diego [Walter Andersen Nursery](https://www.walterandersen.com/), 3642 Enterprise St., San Diego üå± Get growing While you‚Äôre at the nursery, grab some seeds that you can plant right now (or, at least, very soon). [Use this tool to calculate](https://awaytogarden.com/when-to-start-seeds-calculator/) when to sow some of these early-season crops: - Beans - Beets - Broccoli - Cabbage - Kale - Lettuce Can‚Äôt wait for that final frost date? Now is a good time to prep your seed trays. Clean and organize your trays, then sow these plants indoors with a [growing light](https://amzn.to/3ItBnse) to be moved outdoors when the time is right. üå± Routine maintenance Every green thumb knows that a garden is more than just its plants. Here‚Äôs your winter checklist: - Trim and tidy | Toss out any plants that didn‚Äôt survive last year and start fresh. - Take care of your tools | Sharpen your pruners and clean your trowels or treat yourself to a [new tool set](https://amzn.to/3QcZVYy). - Test your soil | Apply your compost, but don‚Äôt forget to test your soil to make sure you aren‚Äôt missing any nutrients. A [soil test kit](https://amzn.to/3QcZVYy)can help you out here. - Prepare for frost | Be prepared for any cold fronts by making sure your watering system is ready for any deep freezes and stocking up on [row covers](https://amzn.to/3X5cLuf). - Plan your beds | Get out your graph paper and dream up your ideal garden. - Join a local gardening group | Plant yourself with locals who also love gardening, like the [San Diego Horticultural Society](https://sdhort.org/)or [Mission Hills Garden Club](https://www.missionhillsgardenclub.org/). What was your most successful plant last year? [Lettuce know ](mailto:Hello@theSDtoday.com)and you might be featured in an upcoming newsletter.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Cloudy today with cooler temps and periods of rain in New Jersey
text:
By Mike Rizzo ,
8 minutes ago
There is a coastal flood advisory in effect for the high tide cycles tonight due to the easterly wind and New Moon tides that will cause very minor flooding due to a higher cycle. Showers continue on and off today. The weather is moving faster than predicted and should depart between 10 p.m. and midnight tonight. Temperatures remain in the mid-50s throughout the day.
Tomorrow starts sunny and the weather remains beautiful with a chance for a p.m. cloud or spot shower over the higher elevations north and west in the late afternoon. Highs will be in the lower 60s.
Sunday will be rainy again, with showers moving across New Jersey throughout much of the morning and early afternoon. Conditions improve slowly by the evening and then sunshine returns for Monday and Tuesday. Sunday's temperatures will be cool again.
Monday's weather warms a bit into the mid-70s. Same for Tuesday with the next round of rain arriving Tuesday night into Wednesday.
Aurora forecast An unusual and rare Coronal Mass Ejection (solar flare) erupted out of the surface of the sun yesterday. This flare send a magnetic field and other particles from the sun toward Earth. They are expected to arrive sometime tonight and through the weekend. Should the timing align with nighttime, Aurora Borealis, AKA the Northern Lights can be very vibrant over the northern hemisphere and they can move farther south than usual. Given the unusual and rare nature of this particular CME/Solar Flare, the aurora can be far enough to be seen along the horizon at higher elevations in Northern New Jersey.
Historically, it has been known that the strongest aurora within these types of events can sometimes be seen as far south as the Carolinas and Alabama. Aurora is not easily predictable and does not last the entire nighttime. They arrive, pop up, strengthen, move, and dissipate at unpredictable intervals and intensity. Sometimes we can have a 30 min lead-time in seeing that some measurements are rising but does not always indicate that aurora will be strong on our side of the planet or close to our area. Often, for New Jersey, aurora in these types of storms can be seen low on the horizon, using a camera with a long exposure, at a higher elevation.
Don't expect aurora to be directly overhead - we'd need an "extreme" level storm to even get a better chance of that. Consider this just a greater possibility of seeing a faint green glow on the northern horizon if viewing at nighttime without the pollution of city lights. Lastly, this type of geomagnetic storm can interrupt GPS, radio, and wireless communication functions the closer to the northern poles. This could make GPS act a bit wonky, especially. NOAA is expected to have media advisory and information here .
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

title: Uccle : les √©v√©nements estivaux au parc de Wolvendael d√©localis√©s apr√®s les r√©cents orages - RTBF Actus
text: Le parc bruxellois du Wolvendael √† Uccle ne pourra pas accueillir les √©v√©nements estivaux pr√©vus en ao√ªt et en septembre en raison des d√©g√¢ts caus√©s par les intemp√©ries du 9 juillet dernier. De nombreux √©v√©nements seront n√©anmoins maintenus et d√©localis√©s ailleurs √† Uccle. "Les conditions m√©t√©orologiques extr√™mes du 9 juillet ont caus√© d‚Äôimportants d√©g√¢ts notamment dans le parc de Wolvendael", explique la commune. "Au vu des travaux cons√©quents que les services communaux doivent encore r√©aliser pour garantir la s√©curit√© du parc, le lieu ne pourra pas accueillir tous les √©v√©nements phares de la vie uccloise qui s‚Äôy d√©roulent habituellement au mois d‚Äôao√ªt et √† la rentr√©e." Toutefois, afin de permettre aux Ucclois de tout de m√™me profiter des festivit√©s estivales, l‚Äôadministration a pris la d√©cision ‚Äì "quand cela s‚Äôav√©rait possible" ‚Äì de les maintenir en les d√©localisant dans d‚Äôautres lieux du territoire communal. Le "Zomer Quartier d‚Äô√©t√© sp√©cial b√©b√©", qui se d√©roulera en matin√©e le 10 ao√ªt, aura lieu √† la biblioth√®que du Centre. Les concerts de "Musiques au parc", pr√©vus le 18 ao√ªt, se produiront √† la Maison des arts d‚ÄôUccle, tandis que "Place √† l‚Äôart" se d√©roulera le 18 ao√ªt au parvis Saint-Pierre. "La Nuit au Wolvendael", r√©partie sur le week-end du 24 au 25 ao√ªt, se tiendra sur la plaine de la Gazelle. En ce qui concerne le Festival Uckel‚ÄôAir (7 septembre), "tous les indicateurs de s√©curit√© sont au vert et laissent entrevoir la possibilit√© que ce festival 100% hip-hop √† destination des jeunes pourra √™tre organis√© dans le bas du parc au niveau du th√©√¢tre de Verdure", se r√©jouit la commune. La Brocante des enfants (8 septembre) est, quant √† elle, annul√©e, sachant que la circulation des voitures dans le parc ne sera pas encore possible √† cette date.
